chargeHist.descr: Fraud Against Financial Institution (Value does not Exceed $500)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua Jerome Skoug was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Forgery-Uttering, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).
  • Fraud Against Financial Institution (Value does not Exceed $500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.82(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Not to have contact with RAG & DG.
Not to use or possess identifying documents including checks of others.
Not to have abusive contact with Eliseo J Pantoja or Sarah Casey.
Not to have contact with known users/dealers except as necessary for treatment or in a confinement setting. 
Cannot vote until civil rights restored, cannot hold elected office, other civil rights may be lost until restored. If not a US citizen, may face deportation or loss of other citizenship rights.

Must follow rules of supervision.
Must provide a DNA sample.  Under Wisconsin Statute 165.76, you are required to provide a biological specimen to the Wisconsin Department of Justice for deoxyribonucleic acid (DNA) testing.  If you fail to provide a DNA sample, you may be held in contempt and subject to sanctions or charged with a new crime.

$250.00 DNA surcharge to be paid to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or set up payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in a tax intercept, license suspension, warrant and/or civil judgment subject to collection efforts. Bond to be applied.

$1,216.95 extradition costs to be paid to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or set up payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in a tax intercept, license suspension, warrant and/or civil judgment subject to collection efforts. Bond to be applied.
May not possess or use firearms and, if considered a violent felony, no body armor.

$1,074 to TDJ with a 10% surcharge to the DA office and 5% surcharge to the COCC. To be paid to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or set up payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in a tax intercept, license suspension, warrant and/or civil judgment subject to collection efforts. Bond to be applied.

$400 to RAG with a 10% surcharge to the DA office and 5% surcharge to the COCC. To be paid to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or set up payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in a tax intercept, license suspension, warrant and/or civil judgment subject to collection efforts. Bond to be applied.

timeConds.notes:
Subject to work release, no good time.
Consecutive to: 21CF473.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

If you fail to provide a DNA sample, you may be held in contempt and subject to sanctions or charged with a new crime.

Attorney Benjamin James Webster in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Daniel James Chapman in court for Joshua Jerome Skoug. CW-clerk.

20CT20-Count 2-PAC 3rd-45 days PCJ, w/ Huber, subj to GT & WR, 24 mo rev w/ credit. 12 mo IID. DNA sample, $200 surcharge, $1,544 fine. Bond to be applied. AODA. Zero credit.

20CT95-Count 3-obstructing-DNA sample, $200 surcharge, $243 costs only. Bond to be applied.

21CM3-Count 3-misd retail theft-w/h, probation 3 yrs. NC with Kwik Trip store in Osceola. 89 days credit. No alcohol, no controlled substances. Medications as prescribed. No contact with TJD or Robo Village. Follow rules of supervision. DNA sample, $200 surcharge, No fine. Restitution: $0.36 to Kwik Trip plus 10% & 5% surcharge.

21CT11-Count 2-hit/run-w/h, probation 3 yrs. NC with RLP & KSP. 89 days credit. No alcohol, no controlled substances. Medications as prescribed. No contact with TJD or Robo Village.
